key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs remain 8 % above JU.com on 94 % of itineraries, with only isolated but deep (15–18 %) undercuts.
Metasearch now shows price parity on 76 % of routes, yet 20 % of OD pairs remain cheaper than JU.com, eroding short-haul yield.
GDS continues to price higher on 97 % of searches, averaging a 7 % mark-up that grows to 8 % for early bookings.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTAs priced above JU.com on 94.1 % of itineraries last week, sustaining an 8 % average uplift.
OTA-lower share, though small at 2.7 %, is rising and now averages 15–18 % below JU.com.
JU.com fares were absent from OTAs in 3.2 % of searches, a slight week-on-week increase.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Dominant scenario with an 8 % premium; down only 0.5 ppt week-on-week.
Small but growing segment with double-digit discounts that threaten direct conversion.
Visibility gaps inching up; no cases of exact price parity recorded.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Regional pattern identical to network: 94 % OTA-higher at an 8 % gap; 2.7 % OTA-lower.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 94.3 % OTA-higher with a 9 % premium; OTA-lower doubled to 3.5 % at 19 % discounts.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 92 % OTA-higher at 7 % premium; 3.5 % undercuts deliver 15–18 % savings.
97.3 % OTA-higher, premium widens to 9 %; undercuts nearly disappear (1.4 %).

mse_highlights.line_content: 76 % of OD pairs priced identically to JU.com, up 7 ppts month-on-month.
19.9 % of itineraries remain cheaper on MSE, though frequency fell 10 ppts MoM.
No MSE-higher cases reported, removing customer distrust on the channel.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Parity strengthened and is holding week-on-week.
One in five searches shows modest 0.1 % average discounts—still meaningful given traffic scale.
Availability gaps doubled MoM, concentrated in non-RS markets.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Matches overall: 76 % parity, 20 % MSE-lower, 4 % missing offers.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity slips to 66 %; discounts rise to 27 % and gaps to 7 %.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Discount share at 23 %; offer gaps at 3.5 %.
Parity peaks at 80 %; discounts at 16 % and gaps at 4 %—monitor early price files.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS fares exceed JU.com on 97 % of itineraries, holding a 7 % average uplift.
Only 2.7 % of searches show GDS-lower fares, albeit with steep 17 % discounts.
Premium widens to 8 % for far-out bookings, intensifying revenue dilution if agencies steer demand early.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Dominant and stable with a 7 % markup.
Slightly up MoM; discounts average 17 % but are sporadic.
Availability gap now negligible after a 57 % MoM reduction.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: GDS higher 95.5 % of time (6 % markup); 3.4 % GDS-lower.
Higher share rises to 97 % with 7 % premium; GDS-lower slips to 3 %.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 95.5 % higher at 6 % premium; 3.6 % lower cases concentrated here.
Premium intensifies: 98.7 % higher at 8 %; lower cases drop to 1.4 %.
